author: jaitnez
title: New d-EdTech Platform for LatAm
description: 拉丁美洲数以百万计的人受到教育标准低和分配不均的影响，以及就业行业的不稳定性。

f6_assessments.q0: 提案团队认为，社会阶层之间的教育差距可能是导致拉美人在卡达诺生态系统中存在率低的原因，作为一个在该地区不止一个国家的公共和私人教育系统中的拉美人，我完全同意声明。虽然它已经在其他生态系统中进行了探索，但该团队计划通过创建一个教育平台来解决这个问题，利用Learn-to-Earn模块可以对CARDANO生态系统产生重大影响。尽管是一个雄心勃勃的项目，该团队巧妙地将其分为5个主要阶段，这使得社区能够评估该团队计划在每个阶段产生的影响。然而，这个提案中可以改进的一个方面是，它将在两年后开始产生 "真正的影响"，因为它计划在那时有行业联系和教师参与。我建议该团队将MVP的试点测试（12个月）作为MVP的交付物，并将测试结果作为成功的衡量标准。
f6_assessments.q1: 团队成员设法集合了非常多样化的技能和经验，涉及广泛的学科。他们提供了LinkedIn上的推荐人，所以经验可以从这个角度得到验证。他们在提案的评论中说，他们有一个具有教育/教学背景的顾问，但遗憾的是，他们没有提供描述，也没有提供参考链接。他们在预算描述方面做得很好，在识别试图成功实施的未来风险方面也是如此。
f6_assessments.q2: 他们很好地描述了从短期（3个月）到长期（3年后）的五个阶段，每个阶段都简要地描述了将要发生的事情。该团队更进一步，向社区解释了短期内将发生的具体事情，包括招募、发展和研究行动。此外，团队详细确定了他们期望的成功指标，我认为这很有意义，特别是从第二年开始，因为这些将是有实际影响的指标。另一个增加可审计性的元素是该平台的开源性质。这将使社区能够详细了解项目的进展情况以及它的方向。

f6_assessments.q0: 这个建议与鼓励拉丁美洲发展的挑战目标对话得非常好，通过创建一个专注于技术的教育平台，这肯定会有助于解决该大陆的教育不稳定和就业机会问题。然而，我希望作者能更清楚地说明Cardano区块链在这里的作用，当然在技术教学中，我们的生态系统会得到很多解决，还有DID的使用，这也与之前背景中的一个挑战（Atala Prism）有很好的联系。尽管如此，我觉得对这个项目如何给Cardano社区带来反馈缺乏保证；我知道这种反馈会存在，但如果有这方面的细节就更好了。关于在非洲大陆有所作为，毫无疑问，这样的项目是非常必要和有前途的，作者还可以具体说明他们的目标受众原则上是哪个拉美国家，哪个年龄段的人，等等。另一个我有疑问的细节是艾毅鲁学院提供的课程费用。他们会用什么货币，阿达，当地货币来支付？课程的平均价格是多少，这些利润将归谁所有？如果我们能更好地了解这个平台的财务部分是如何运作的，那会很有趣，虽然我知道这些是细节，但也是相关的细节。从整体上看，该项目符合这一挑战的要求。
f6_assessments.q1: 这里所涉及的团队当然有资格很好地执行这个项目；我们知道他们是谁，他们的名字，他们的背景和以前的经历的简史，还有他们的LinkedIn资料，在那里我们可以更详细地了解他们每个人。然而，有趣的是，如果作者表现出更大的兴趣，关注平台的可用性部分，即建立一个简单和符合人体工程学的用户体验设计，以进一步提高项目的效益，通过使目标受众有轻松的导航。另外就是营销的问题，不清楚他们是否打算雇佣一个专业的人，负责进行这部分的项目，甚至是一个宣传团队，这个宣传会怎么做等等。这是一个巨大的项目，所以它需要大量的宣传来接触公众。关于构成整个项目的步骤，作者非常清楚地说明了在特定的时间段内会发生什么。正如他们所做的那样，在几个月内所取得的成功的同时，画出要完成的活动的时间表总是有益的。而关于预算，也解释得很详细，所以我们对所要求的资金将如何使用，哪些部分将花费多少等等有一个坚实的了解。
f6_assessments.q2: 建议书的这一部分非常完整，我们有必要的关键绩效指标来了解项目是否实现了它的意图，我们知道团队的雄心壮志是什么，甚至与平台上的学生数量有关。我发现非常有趣的是，他们画出了一个理想的场景，即一切都会以最好的方式发生的背景，这涉及到自我可持续发展等等。我还建议，在项目的执行过程中，团队和Cardano社区之间有一些沟通渠道，因为它是巨大的，涉及多个方面（编程、设计、教育、营销）。可以定期举行会议，甚至交付部分成果，我们可以用它来评估事情的进展。但这是一个额外的建议，我认为这里的可审计性是很好的。

f6_assessments.q0: The key metrics and goal of this proposal also align with the challenge settings, that is developing application that might be useful in other parts of the world. And also this proposal will give impact on their local communities, by adding value to increase the education by giving Plutus course in Spanish for LatAm community members.
f6_assessments.q1: The team consists of several Plutus Pioneers and also experience management team. And they provide valid LinkedIn profile. Budget is outlined clearly and broken down properly. And the sum is still reasonable in my opinion to develop an educational platform. Moreover, the team also include realistic time frame to complete the work that they mention in the proposal. The proposal clearly describes the resources necessary to implement the proposal, such as development team & academic advisor on it. If funded, I think this team could implement their proposal accordingly.
f6_assessments.q2: The team break down their roadmap & phase into several parts. And I think this helps the team to achieve their milestone in a good way. The metrics and KPI are defined clearly in 3 phases, such as short/medium/long term goals. It would be great if they could also include GitHub or website link, so that the community could track their project progress if funded.

f6_assessments.q0: The New EdTech platform for LatAm will help to draw new community members into Cardano Ecosystem by deploying the Learn-to-earn model. The EdTech platform is very much needed for LatAm community and has a very high potential to scale.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer team is comprised of 4 individual team members from different countries in the region give the broad perspective of scaling the product into this region. The budget is broken down in detail although it seems quite high for educational content creators. The proposal outlines a realistic timetable for the implementation but did not go into detail about platform and technical know-how required to build the platform. This could pose potential challenge to implement the proposal successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The project will be open-source. It also has milestone and timeline to split project into phases making it easy to audit and monitor the progress. It should elaborate more on the technology aspect and the edTech platform features that would be included...

f6_assessments.q0: What a great way to grow Cardano's impact in Latin America. Having Spanish-language open-source education is the most important first step.
f6_assessments.q1: This team has an incredible amount of experience in software development. Through their qualifications you can see that this team is experienced, organized and ready to start building. Additionally, their proposal has KPIs, a project schedule, and a budget breakdown that proves the team can be effective.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal outlines their kPIs, project schedule, and budget breakdown. From this information, the Foundation and community can audit the project's progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about building an EdTech platform that incentivizes participation to promote growth in a technology-oriented educational landscape, and relevant job industry. This is a great idea (an open-source Learn-to-Earn). The problem is clearly described, and explained in detail with the context in LatAm. Solving this problem is fit for this challenge.
The solution is clearly defined with a timeframe for the short, mid, and long term. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1:
Team profile is clearly described with suitable skills, experiences for implementation. however, it would be better if the information of demo/pilot is provided. The roadmap is clearly defined with short, mid, and long term. The budget is clearly described (with a total budget, items structure, and explanations of calculation base). There is a lack of risk and mitigation.

Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 4
f6_assessments.q2:
There is full of information provided, with external links for verification. However, there is a lacks: (1) information of demo/pilot; (2) Risks and mitigation. 
Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 4. If the missing information listed above was fulfilled, I would give this 5 points.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seeks to create a platform that will help the transfer of knowledge to keep individuals ready to work, and to keep a healthier pace in the life cycles of the industry. The challenge is quite addressed.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is made up of Plutus Pioneer, 20 years experience in software engineering, 15 years and above as DevOps expertise, marketing advisors, who will be able to successfully implement the proposal. The plan mentions market and product, new recipe for transferring knowledge derived from industry, content in Spanish, technology oriented topics, tokenized incentive mechanism, native token incentives for learning. All these will make the implementation successful.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap mentioned is clear from January 2022 to March 2022. The budget is well broken down for effective auditing.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the challenge very effectively and delivers a thorough plan to create an educational technology platform for people in Latin America to become job-ready individuals and for the growth of Cardano ecosystem in Latin American countries. In my opinion, the author clearly understands these issues, is competent, motivated, and shows profound engagements with Latin American community as well as Project Catalyst and Cardano system.
f6_assessments.q1:
I strongly agree this proposal is likely to be successful implemented. The proposal provides all characteristic of a feasible proposal: evidence of relevant skills and experience of the team needed for the implementation and team members' information; fairly budget is split into items very clearly and be reasonable to achieve the set goals; a sensible and conductible plan with realistic timetable to complete the work; the necessary resources are described in details in the proposal in short term phase of the plan (to develop and implement a Proof of Concept (PoC)). In addition,  the project is bilingual (English and Spanish version, as we can see in the proposal and the AYLLU ACADEMY files attached in the proposal), so that language barrier is no longer the problem for people in Latin American countries of technology-oriented education. 
In my opinion, it would be greater if the proposal considers challenges and risks relevent to the successful implementation (might be in the short term success, not a whole)
f6_assessments.q2:
In my opinion, the proposal is fully auditable because of the following points:
. The proposal has a roadmap with milestones and time horizon for achievement; clear understandable the description of the targeted problem (Basic features of PoC) as well as the solution that addresses the problem.
. Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal are set clearly, easy to see and easy to audit (we should focus on the short term success to assess the Auditability as the proposal's current plan).
There is a small mistake in Phase B of short term roadmap and KPIs: I believe the author means Phase B in 4 month mark instead of 7 month mark.
Since I extremely agree with the proposal, I would like to see more details about how to distribute this platform for the people in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
-Quality technical training in spanish is both a great use case for Cardano and a powerful way to expand it's awareness and adoption in Latam, therefore a stong alignment with the Challenge is evidenced.
-The proposal is highly scalable to a have global reach in the future.
-Would be great to see a more specific commitment to include Cardano/Plutus/Marlowe content in the description since as it is written there is no assurance of providing Cardano focused content.
f6_assessments.q1:
-Evidence is provided of a very strong team behind this proposal. They have a strong bond to LatinAmerica as well as the adecuate set of experience credibility and skills to deliver.
-The proposal is thourough and well structured, a complete and detailed implementation plan is in place.
-The budget provided is clear and reasonable.
-Clear goals are set.
-Future funding will most likely be required for next stages.
-In the future team could benefit from bringing in a Marketing/growth/sales talent to support a good scaling speed.
f6_assessments.q2:
-Delivery on the proposal's plan is verifiable in each stage and the KPIs proposed seem to be a good way to measure success.
-In order to track progress it would be great to include in the proposal some means of progress reporting.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is bringing a much needed decentralized EdTech solution to LatAm a region in great demand for this type of tool to help advance its societies. The proposal is perfect for this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team members come from technical software engineering backgrounds, are SPOs and have completed the Plutus Pioneer program. They also delivered a proposal containing an overview, timeline, KPI and other key information such as cost breakdown and definition of success.
f6_assessments.q2: The team is already heavily engaged in Cardano technical processes and their proposal is complete/well packaged. All info needed to audit progress is included.

solution: 教育科技平台，激励参与，以促进以技术为导向的教育景观的增长，以及相关的就业行业。
experience: Plutus先锋，20多年的软件工程经验，15年以上的DEVOPS专业知识，由商业和营销顾问提供咨询。
